DOC.brief_summary: This study determine effectiveness two-step HIV prevention program reduce risky sexual practice decrease incidence sexually transmit disease ( STDs ) .
DOC.brief_title: HIV Prevention Program Patients Receiving Care Sexually Transmitted Diseases Clinic
DOC.detailed_description: Numerous factor influence one 's sexual choice , include social support pressure , internal feeling belief , knowledge subject . Data indicate people well-informed risk associate certain sexual behavior likely protect less informed . This study determine whether intervention comprise information , motivation , behavioral skill component effective information-only workshop change sexual behavior HIV prevention . At study entry , participant undergo physical exam , various STD test , rapid HIV test , provide test result within several hour . While wait test result study clinic , participant complete computerized questionnaire assess thought , feeling , behavior regard sexual activity . Participants also expose one two brief health promotion intervention : motivational , one-on-one counseling session DVD safer sex . After receive test result , participant ask complete brief postassessment questionnaire attitude toward test result intervention . Two-thirds participant invite attend intensive , 4-hour safer sex workshop . These participant randomly assign one two workshop : information-only workshop workshop include information , motivation , behavioral skill component . Participants choose participate workshop complete study receive STD HIV test result . Participants participate workshop return clinic 3 , 6 , 12 month workshop complete another questionnaire sexual behavior give urine sample STD testing .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis symptom STD within 3 month prior study entry OR unprotected vaginal anal intercourse one following : two sexual partner , partner two partner , anonymous partner , injection drugusing partner , partner STD Able understand English Psychosis impair mental status would prevent participant providing inform consent Have test HIV within 3 month prior study entry HIV infect
